trans-unit.source: Median Filter
trans-unit.target: Median Filter

trans-unit.source: Creates a median filter used to smooth data for trend analysis
trans-unit.target: Creates a median filter used to smooth data for trend analysis

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="529B4991-8A7F-4E12-8F36-51F9FACA4383" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Filter</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="529B4991-8A7F-4E12-8F36-51F9FACA4383" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Data Transformation / Filter</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Median Filter</ui> module to define a <newTerm>median filter</newTerm> for applying to a series of values that represent a digital input signal or image.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Median Filter</ui> module to define a <newTerm>median filter</newTerm> for applying to a series of values that represent a digital input signal or image.

trans-unit.source: In digital signal processing, the use of filters can improve the results of image or voice recognition.
trans-unit.target: In digital signal processing, the use of filters can improve the results of image or voice recognition.

trans-unit.source: Median filters are widely used in image recognition to reduce noise so that features can more easily be detected.
trans-unit.target: Median filters are widely used in image recognition to reduce noise so that features can more easily be detected.

trans-unit.source: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs by using the <ui>Median Filter</ui> module, you can apply the filter to data by connecting a dataset and the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have defined a filter that meets your needs by using the <ui>Median Filter</ui> module, you can apply the filter to data by connecting a dataset and the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Median Filter
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Median Filter

trans-unit.source: Add the <ui>Median Filter</ui> and <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> modules to your experiment.
trans-unit.target: Add the <ui>Median Filter</ui> and <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> modules to your experiment.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Median Filter</ui>, specify the length of the filter window.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Median Filter</ui>, specify the length of the filter window.

trans-unit.source: Connect the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module, and connect the dataset whose values you want to change.
trans-unit.target: Connect the filter to the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module, and connect the dataset whose values you want to change.

trans-unit.source: In <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.
trans-unit.target: In <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link>, use the Column Selector to specify which columns the filter should be applied to.

trans-unit.source: By default, the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module will use the filter for all selected numeric columns, so be sure to exclude any columns that you don’t want to change.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <link xlink:href="278e11ec-cb16-49d4-a13c-54b2c9f5ce88" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Apply Filter</link> module will use the filter for all selected numeric columns, so be sure to exclude any columns that you don’t want to change.

trans-unit.source: No computations are performed until you run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: No computations are performed until you run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:
trans-unit.target: At that point, the following operations are applied to the selected columns:

trans-unit.source: For each set of values included in the window or mask, the filter algorithm computes the median.
trans-unit.target: For each set of values included in the window or mask, the filter algorithm computes the median.

trans-unit.source: The current (or index) value is replaced with the median value.
trans-unit.target: The current (or index) value is replaced with the median value.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: Length
trans-unit.target: Length

trans-unit.source: Type a number that defines the total size of the mask across which the filter is applied.
trans-unit.target: Type a number that defines the total size of the mask across which the filter is applied.

trans-unit.source: The size of the window, sometimes called a <newTerm>mask</newTerm>, should be an odd, positive-valued integer.
trans-unit.target: The size of the window, sometimes called a <newTerm>mask</newTerm>, should be an odd, positive-valued integer.

trans-unit.source: If you specify an even number, the mask size is reduced by one.
trans-unit.target: If you specify an even number, the mask size is reduced by one.

trans-unit.source: By default the mask begins at the current value and extends forward for the specified number of units.
trans-unit.target: By default the mask begins at the current value and extends forward for the specified number of units.

trans-unit.source: In other words, it creates a <newTerm>one-sided average</newTerm>.
trans-unit.target: In other words, it creates a <newTerm>one-sided average</newTerm>.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how filters are used in machine learning, see this experiment in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates all filter types, using an engineered waveform dataset for illustration.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Filters</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525732</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates all filter types, using an engineered waveform dataset for illustration.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Each entry in the output signal is equal to the median of the entries in a subset (mask) of the input signal, and centered at the corresponding index.
trans-unit.target: Each entry in the output signal is equal to the median of the entries in a subset (mask) of the input signal, and centered at the corresponding index.

trans-unit.source: The mask size should be an odd, positive-valued integer.
trans-unit.target: The mask size should be an odd, positive-valued integer.

trans-unit.source: If you provide this method with an even-valued mask size, it is reduced by one.
trans-unit.target: If you provide this method with an even-valued mask size, it is reduced by one.

trans-unit.source: For example, given <math>m=2q+1</math>, the filter is defined as:
trans-unit.target: For example, given <math>m=2q+1</math>, the filter is defined as:

trans-unit.source: <math>y</math><subscript>i</subscript><math> =median[{x</math><subscript>i-q</subscript>,…, <math>x</math><subscript>i+q</subscript><math>}]</math>
trans-unit.target: <math>y</math><subscript>i</subscript><math> =median[{x</math><subscript>i-q</subscript>,…, <math>x</math><subscript>i+q</subscript><math>}]</math>

trans-unit.source: Values beyond the borders of the input signal are assumed to equal the value at the border:
trans-unit.target: Values beyond the borders of the input signal are assumed to equal the value at the border:

trans-unit.source: where <math>n</math> is the length of the input signal.
trans-unit.target: where <math>n</math> is the length of the input signal.

trans-unit.target: For more information about median filters, this Wikipedia article provides a good explanation of the theory and application:

trans-unit.target: Wikipedia: Median Filters
